meanings.definition: A person who is unwilling to spend money; a miser.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is such a cheapskate that he never buys anything new.
meanings.sent2: The cheapskate refused to contribute to the group gift.
meanings.sent3: The cheapskate brought their own tea bags to the fancy restaurant.
meanings.sent4: She was a cheapskate with her kindness, hoarding it like treasure.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cheapskate counting pennies at the store stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To be stingy or frugal in spending money.
meanings.sent1: I cheapskate my way through the month by avoiding unnecessary purchases.
meanings.sent2: She tends to cheapskate when it comes to buying gifts for others.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cheapskate on his vacation by camping instead of staying in a hotel.
meanings.sent4: The company had to cheapskate on office supplies to meet the budget.
meanings.sent5: I cheapskate on electricity by turning off lights when not needed.
